translated: Elder’s Birth Stories🔽The Chapter about the One who Gave a Leaf
Just like a lion, a forest-wanderer,🔽like a bull, a leader of the herd;
Siddhattha, the light of the world,
the one who heals all the world;
with a serene mind🔽I went out to meet him.
I went out to meet the human bull;
I do not know of a bad destination,
this is the fruit of going out to meet (the Buddha).
I was a lord of the people,
I have done the Buddha’s bidding.”🔽Thus the elder Paccuggami recited these verses.

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā paccuggamaniyo thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.🔽Paccuggamaniyattherassāpadānaṁ tatiyaṁ.
analyzed: ittham sudam āyasmā paccuggamaniyaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati 🔽paccuggamaniya therassa apadānam
translated: The Elder Paccuggami’s Birth Story, the third.
